Title: Automation Solutions Specialist
RoleDescription: PROCESS ANALYSISYou'll conduct thorough analysis of existing business processes to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, areas for improvement and the benefits of using an automation. You'll also collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and understand pain points in order to develop a comprehensive understanding of the as-is processes.In addition, you'll document process flows, data flows, and business rules to provide clear visual representation and understanding of the current processes. You'll identify opportunities for automation, standardization, and optimization to enhance process efficiency and effectiveness. PROCESS AUTOMATION DESIGNYou'll assess the feasibility of implementing automation by considering the complexity of the process flow, compatibility with existing applications, and any potential technical or operational challenges. You'll also design automation workflows by specifying the sequence of tasks, decision points, and integration with relevant systems or tools. This ensures a logical flow of actions, efficient decision-making, and seamless interaction with other systems.Finally, you'll also configure and customise automation tools, including defining rules, triggers, and data mappings to ensure accurate and efficient execution. PROJECT MANAGEMENT OF THE FULL LIFECYCLEYou'll lead and oversee the full lifecycle of automation projects, from initiation to implementation and post-deployment support, ensuring successful delivery and achievement of project objectives. You'll also define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders, setting clear goals and success criteria for automation initiatives. Finally, you'll evaluate project outcomes, conduct post-implementation reviews, capture lessons learned, and identify opportunities for continuous improvement to drive future automation project success. COMMUNICATION BRIDGE BETWEEN BUSINESS PROCESS OWNERS AND DEVELOPERSYou'll facilitate clear and concise communication by translating technical jargon into business terms and vice versa, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical implementation. You'll actively engage with business process owners to gather and clarify their needs, goals, and challenges, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of their requirements and objectives. Finally, you'll collaborate closely with developers/IT teams to provide guidance, clarification, and context on business processes, ensuring smooth integration and alignment with technical solutions.
